metadata.dc:author: Martín Escobar, E
Saiz García, F
Martín Hernández, R
de Arriba de la Fuente, G
García Martín, F
Perales Cabanas, L
metadata.dc:description: Herein we describe a patient with noninsulin dependent diabetes mellitus who developed acute anuric renal failure following eye surgery. This condition, ascribable to diabetic neurogenic bladder and probably to the use of anticholinergic agents, improved following placement of a urethral catheter. The physiopathological mechanisms and treatment are discussed.
metadata.dc:title: Fracaso renal agudo anúrico en paciente con vejiga neurógena diabética.
[Acute anuric renal failure in a patient with diabetic neurogenic bladder].
